string.name: address_data_loading
string.translation_description: Message displayed to the user when data is being loaded from the server. The u2026 is the unicode character for the ellipses (...)

string.name: please_select
string.translation_description: Message shown for a dropdown menu in which nothing is yet selected.

string.name: i18n_country_or_region_label
string.translation_description: A country or a political region (Countries like the United States or regions like Hong Kong or Macao, or places like Taiwan, where whether it is a country or not is a politically sensitive question). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_locality_label
string.translation_description: A city or town, such as New York City [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_post_town
string.translation_description: The name of a town through which postal deliveries are routed, present in UK addresses. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post_town [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_suburb
string.translation_description: Smaller part of a city used in some addresses in countries like New Zealand to give a more specific location in a postal address. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_townland
string.translation_description: A small geographical division of land in Ireland, shown as part of an address input. Semantically similar to a neighborhood or local district, this is typically the smallest division of land which can be named in an address. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Townland

string.name: i18n_village_township
string.translation_description: A unit used in postal addresses in Malaysia, which is smaller than the city/town, and represents a village, township, or precinct. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_address_line1_label
string.translation_description: Street-level part of an address, e.g. "18th Street, Unit 3". [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_eir_code_label
string.translation_description: Eircode. A two part, seven character alpha-numeric code used by the postcode system in Ireland. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_pin_code_label
string.translation_description: PIN (Postal Index Number) Code. Values are numeric. Used in India. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_postal_code_label
string.translation_description: Postal Code. Values are frequently alphanumeric. Used in countries such as Switzerland. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_zip_code_label
string.translation_description: ZIP code. Used in countries like the US. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_area
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for Hong Kong (e.g. Kowloon). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_county
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for the United Kingdom (e.g. Yorkshire). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_department
string.translation_description: Administrative Area, as used for countries like Nicaragua (e.g. Boaco). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_district
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for Nauru Central Pacific (e.g. Aiwo district), or area of a town (a neighborhood/suburb) used for addresses in Korea and China. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_do_si
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for Korea (e.g. Gyeonggi-do or Busan-si). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_emirate
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for United Arab Emirates (e.g. Abu Dhabi). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_island
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for certain countries (e.g. Bahama's Cat Island). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_oblast
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for certain countries (e.g. Russia's Leningrad). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_parish
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for certain countries (e.g. Andorra's Canillo). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_prefecture
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for Japan (e.g. Hokkaido). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_province
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for certain countries (e.g. Canada's Ontario). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_state
string.translation_description: Administrative Area for certain countries (e.g. California in the USA). [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_recipient_label
string.translation_description: Label indicating the person to be contacted as part of this address, to be used for example as "Name: John Doe". [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_neighborhood
string.translation_description: Label for a neighborhood, shown as part of an address input form. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_organization_label
string.translation_description: Label for the field of organization, firm, company, or institution in an address. Examples of values in this field: Google, Department of Transportation, University of Cambridge. [CHAR LIMIT=30]

string.name: i18n_missing_required_field
string.translation_description: Error message shown with a UI field when it is a required field and the user has not filled it out. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: unknown_entry
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out the wrong value for an address field. For example, this would be shown when putting 'Cupertino' in United States' State field. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: unrecognized_format_eir_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out an Eircode that does not conform to Ireland's two-part, seven alpha-numeric character format. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: unrecognized_format_pin_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out a PIN code that does not conform to the country's PIN code format. For example, this would be shown when using '123' as an Indian PIN code, which is normally 6 digits long. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: unrecognized_format_postal_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out a postal code that does not conform to the country's postal code format. For example, this would be shown when using '80' as a Swiss postal code, which is normally 4 digits long. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: unrecognized_format_zip_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out a ZIP code that does not conform to the country's ZIP code format. For example, this would be shown when using '901' as a ZIP code for the United States. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: mismatching_value_eir_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out the wrong Eircode for a certain location. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: mismatching_value_pin_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out the wrong PIN code for a certain location. For example, this would be shown when using 456001 for New Delhi, India. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: mismatching_value_postal_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out the wrong postal code for a certain location. For example, this would be shown when using Z3Z 2Y7 for Alberta, Canada. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: mismatching_value_zip_code
string.translation_description: Occurs when the user fills out the wrong ZIP code for a certain location. For example, this would be shown when using 10001 for Arizona state. [CHAR LIMIT=20]

string.name: i18n_address_line1_accessibility_label
string.translation_description: Accessibility label for the text field of the first street address line. [CHAR LIMIT=50]

string.name: i18n_address_line2_accessibility_label
string.translation_description: Accessibility label for the text field of the second street address line. [CHAR LIMIT=50]
